TutorialScript.TutorialStep: Tuesday and all anyone can worry about is this stupid final.
But before the bell rings, Monica has some real business to take care of: what will her legacy be?
I mean like, everyone expects her to be crowned Prom Queen yet again. But when you've worn that crown ever since freshman year, it starts to get a little old.
She supposes preppie boy Nicholas is her best shot at a prom date. But, OMG wait... isn't the word that he's dating some nobody?

Oh right, there she is... that quiet girl, Kate. Poor thing. She probably doesn't even realize Nicholas is just using her. I mean, it would practically be doing her a favor to steal him away from her.

Of course, her BFF Cassandra would never let her hear the end of it. That girl's been getting more and more on Monica's nerves lately. Are they really friends, or just pretending to be? She can't even remember any more.
Maybe it's time to cut ties with these hangers-on and find a new crowd. But who?
Oh, no. It's true, Monica and Edward were friends before he turned all goth on her, but that was forever ago. There's no way she's going to start hanging out with those weirdos...
...although it would shake things up if she showed up to prom with *him* on her arm.
...and hey, freckle girl can come too. Now *there'd* be a prom night to remember.
Tick them off, turn them on, maybe even slink out of the spotlight entirely. Anything but another prom queen crown. How totally boring.
